intro: Ranunculus pedunculatus, commonly known as the meadow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, saucer-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces a distinctive, hairy stem that supports its showy blooms. Ranunculus pedunculatus is often found in open, sunny habitats and is a common sight in early spring.
